decks.notes: The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through card advantage and board interaction. With a solid suite of counter spells like Force of Will and Dovin's Veto, coupled with efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Card selection and manipulation through Brainstorm and Ponder allow for consistency in drawing key cards. Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional value and control options. The deck also has win conditions in the form of Entreat the Angels and Monastery Mentor for late-game stabilization.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, then using efficient reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Unmask to protect the combo pieces and clear the way for victory. With the ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt opponents, this deck aims to overwhelm and overpower opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold deck is to establish an early aggressive presence on the board with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game through a combination of card advantage from Brainstorm and Ponder, along with land disruption from cards like Wasteland. By applying pressure while disrupting the opponent, the deck seeks to quickly close out games before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand while also generating value through efficient card draw and removal spells. The key strategy involves utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to gain incremental advantage while countering threats with cards like Force of Will and Dovin's Veto. Retrofitter Foundry provides additional value by creating artifact tokens, and cards like Terminus and Council's Judgment help to reset the board when needed. The deck aims to grind out the opponent, out-valuing them over the course of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck also includes cards like Daretti, Karn, and Goblin Welder to tutor for combo pieces, disrupt opponent's strategies, and protect the combo with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Red Elemental Blast. Blood Moon is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Lion's Eye Diamond provide additional utility and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on efficiently executing the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's gameplay by utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, along with cards like Phyrexian Revoker to shut down key cards. It also aims to control the board with cards like Karakas and Wasteland, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Mirran Crusader. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play and maintain tempo. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan in order to secure a victory through efficient creature beats and disruption.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive human creatures with disruptive abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's plays while quickly building up a board presence with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant. The inclusion of Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a solid mana base and access to powerful lands like Karakas, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the battlefield while maintaining card advantage and tempo. By utilizing efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, along with versatile creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction. The inclusion of cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation further adds to the deck's ability to protect its threats and control the board, creating a fast-paced and dynamic playstyle.

This control deck focuses on disruption and value through cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Force of Will, while also generating card advantage with Arcum's Astrolabe, Ponder, and Brainstorm. The deck features a mix of removal and threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix for additional value and versatility. The mana base is built around utilizing snow-covered lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, and ritual spells, while digging through your library for combo pieces using cantrips like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder. Once all the necessary pieces are in hand, the deck aims to cast Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent by utilizing storm count and life drain. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and stay ahead of the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures. By sacrificing creatures such as Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp, the player can dredge through their deck, putting high-powered creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Flayer of the Hatebound into play. Through cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return, the player can create an overwhelming board presence with creatures like Prized Amalgam and Ichorid. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy can be used to disrupt the opponent's strategies. Overall, the key concept is to quickly and explosively overwhelm the opponent with graveyard-based creatures.

The deck focuses on resource denial and disruption, using cards like Wasteland, Smallpox, and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's resources. It also has a strong emphasis on planeswalker control with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope. The inclusion of cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Maze of Ith provide additional defensive options. Crucible of Worlds allows for consistent land destruction with cards like Wasteland. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with attrition and out-value them with card advantage and board control.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using a variety of Sliver creatures that support each other. By utilizing Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls, the deck can quickly deploy multiple Slivers while also protecting them with Force of Will and other disruptive spells. The inclusion of key Slivers such as Predatory, Sinew, and Striking Sliver enhances the deck's ability to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Karakas and Mutavault to provide additional advantages in combat and flexibility in its strategy.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful infect creature, such as Blighted Agent or Glistener Elf, and use pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent in one attack. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its key creatures, while also utilizing Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and slow down the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Library provide additional utility and card advantage to support the combo strategy.

This deck aims to quickly and aggressively control the board using low-cost spells and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Delver of Secrets, and Stormchaser Mage. By maximizing the use of cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, the deck seeks to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent. Utilizing the recursive ability of Dreadhorde Arcanist, along with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will, the deck looks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while delivering consistent damage to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to protect its own threats such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Monastery Mentor while also utilizing planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate advantage. The inclusion of cards like Back to Basics and Terminus help to further control the board state and limit the opponent's options. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to the necessary resources.
